children.subject:
It's a fun class! You'll probably be fine without 61C but 149 does go over caches again. That's the one thing that sticks out because caches tripped me up and I cried a little inside when they came up in 149. Also you'll see a lot of finite state machines (if it's still like when I took it a year and a half ago). While 149 does have the labs, there still is a project towards the end of the semester. It's fairly open-ended and people get really creative!

Oh also, don't buy the textbook. The professors will link it for you.

(And I also have heard 192 is super fun)
Out of curiosity, did you end up taking 149? How does it compare to 102B for someone who wants to learn how to tinker?

No I didn't end up taking it. Conflicted with another requirement (twice in a row). I talked a bit to the TA's though, and it seems like they've really improved it. If I had another chance to take it I definitely would.

102B doesn't teach anything tbh. It's a couple relatively simple arduino labs, and a provides a little bit of structure/support for a very large freeform project. You end up learning a lot, but you teach yourself.

Also, 149 doesn't cover any hardware or circuit design if I remember correctly, so if that's what you mean by tinkering it might not be what you're looking for either.

If you're interested in a structured introduction to "making" (if that's what you mean by tinkering), maybe one of the jacobs classes would be helpful.
Thanks for your response. I think I'll probably take EE 192 then :)

That doesn't really answer my question. 192 seems somewhat similar to ME 102B, which is our capstone class, and is taught in the spring anyways. Also I'm asking about 149 in particular because it can be petitioned (somewhat easily) to count for a MechE requirement that I don't really want to deal with. Also I want to have some broader lab experience and learn C/C++ better rather than just doing one huge project. I've already taken EE128, 106A, and am taking 106B so don't recommend those. So I repeat, does anyone know about EECS 149?

history.content:
I'm a junior MechE with EECS minor and only learned about EECS 149 just now (I didn't know about the switch from EE to EECS and thought it had been discontinued). It looks super cool, and I want to take it before I graduate.

Will it be offered Fall 2017? And will non-majors have a super hard time getting in (if phase 1)? Also, is 61C really necessary? @1773 seems to indicate that it isn't, but I want to make sure in case I have to take it this semester.

Thanks!
history.subject: Will EECS C149 be offered next fall?
